Saffa Slang Word of the day

EISH (Aysh) 

A colloquial exclamation of surprise, disapproval, exasperation or regret derived from the isiXhosa language.
‘Eish Freddie! I broke my toe!’.

#ETHCapeTown #mondaythoughts

1097496745523712000.text:
Saffa slang word of the day
HOWZIT ("Hah-zit")
Translated: “How are you/things?”, or simply “Hello”.

Let's sum up the last few weeks into a one-liner:

"HOWZIT Stan my BRU!? How was your weekend?"
"I had a BRAAI on Sunday which was LEKKER!"

Now, you're basically a local!

1096389224318799873.text:
Come rain or sunshine, carnivore or vegan, South Africans will BRAAI.
It's a celebration of cooking in the most traditional way.
Fire & wood.

We don't play around here, so keep your gas stove at home.

Here are the real differences between a #BRAAIvsBBQhttps://tinyurl.com/y4ynqjk4

1096046141085569025.text:
Not sure what to expect when visiting Cape Town in April? 

The weather? The food?
Fear not! These essential tips should clear up any doubt!

Still have a question or two? 
Leave your question in the comments 
#CapeTown #travelguidehttps://medium.com/@hello_39396/cape-town-essentials-ac0968accf20 …

1094943647034953730.text:
Monday's Saffa slang word of the day

JOL, JOLLING ("Jawl")

A strange noun of the Afrikaans language meaning "party" or "fun". Beware, this one is contagious 

"Are you going JOLLING after work on Friday Tina?"
"Based on last weekend's JOL, you bet Meg!"

#ETHCapeTown #jolvolpic.twitter.com/BNnb5UmBJ5

1093878251158753283.text:
Hate to be a jerk about SA's take on "jerky" but BILTONG is just so much tastier. 
The deal is...we simply do not share.
Ever.

#ETHCapeTown #BiltongIsLifepic.twitter.com/uMnXXdifaT

1093201057444958208.text:
When the weather is just right and the sunset creates the perfect mood, 
cue Table Mountain.

Just when you think it doesn't get any better than this, the legendary white table cloth makes an appearance.

Howsit Mother Nature!

Wine 'n dine baby,
wine 'n dine.
#CapeTown #sunsetpic.twitter.com/dG2pBdAC4M

1092494372732653570.text:
Monday's Saffa slang word of the day.

BRU (br-uuu)

Often used as a gender-neutral term of affection from the Afrikaans word
"broer", meaning "brother". Another way to say, bro or dude.

"Can you pass the mustard, Timmy?"
"Of course, my BRU!"
"Lekker, thanks!"

#ETHCapetownpic.twitter.com/gdto5usv1Y

1092396184428339206.text:

1091046948143095809.text:
Cape Town is running low on its H2O supply so remember to ask 
for extra luggage allowance when you fly in your own water for thirst & hygiene. 
Kidding! We have water but we've just experienced a gnarly drought and ask you to be water-wise! See more here:http://www.capetown.travel/visitors/plan/save-like-a-local-how-visitors-can-help-during-cape-towns-drought/ …

1090271718919159808.text:

1089872225522593793.text:
Our Monday SA 'Saffa' slang word of the day!

LEKKER

When something is good/pleasant, used to describe anything in a positive light.
"How is your day going, buddy?" "Ya, it's going lekker my dude!".

And when things are super good you say it over & over as demonstrated below! pic.twitter.com/h4LykMEQlB

1088790378361298945.text:
Keen on kiteboarding?

#CapeTown is one of the best places on earth to get involved.

If you're not into kiteboarding yet, that's ok!
It's still worth taking a visit to SA's "most Instagrammed" spot, Blouberg Beach, as the views are clearly insane!
#ETHCapeTown #BlownAway #kitingpic.twitter.com/jfDK6Tdxgc

1088444150704353280.text: Just a heads up for when you're in South Africa... Yes, there are cars and roads but some of us still ride our giraffes and hippos to work. So in order to avoid traffic jams 10x worse than Los Angeles, DO NOT FEED THE ANIMALS mkay. Thanks, Bru. #ETHCapeTown #ETHGlobalpic.twitter.com/mTJeep2ts6

1087732359250747392.text:

1087385953822478339.text:
Our Monday South African "Saffa" slang word of the day!

BRAAI
Pronounced "br-eye", known as a typical Saffa BBQ & social custom that we hold close to our hearts.

To us, braai is more than just a word. It's really the "the only way to eat" and even "the only way to live". JK pic.twitter.com/nUjHQlEmU3

1085912738059022337.text:
